Based on the user's preference cues, here are two potential recommendations:

1. Out of the Dust (1997) - This classic novel by Kristin Hannah tells the story of Sara Crewe, a young girl from a wealthy family in London, who is sent to boarding school after her father enlists in WWI.
Sara soon discovers that life at boarding school is far more difficult than she ever imagined. As she navigates through the challenges and hardships at boarding school, Sara must also confront her own inner demons and insecurities. Throughout this gripping and emotionally charged story, Kristin Hannah masterfully weaves together a rich tapestry of characters, relationships, conflicts, and resolutions.
Out of the Dust is available for rent or purchase on various streaming platforms.

2. The Old Man and the Sea (1952) - This classic novel by Ernest Hemingway tells the story of Sven Nordahl, an aging fisherman from a small coastal town in Sweden, who has been struggling to make ends meet for many years.
One day, while Sven is out at sea fishing with his boatmate, who happens to be none other than Sven's estranged wife, Anna-Lena, who recently got remarried to another man named Viktor, and now that they have both become happily married again to each other, they have now decided that it would be best for them if they could just go and live in a different country or even continent altogether, instead of trying to maintain their existing marriage and relationship with each other any longer.
